data.title: Best burrito in area
data.text: We needed lunch and this was a convinent stop on the 101 coast highway. Ordering at the counter was fast and the staff was friendly. The tables were filled near the counter but they have a sitting area around back. It didn't take long to get our food and two wait people delieved our meal. The burritos are amazing, by far some of the best I've had in California.

data.title: Healthy breakfast burritos and more
data.text: After a long morning walk, I sometimes like to eat big.  My craving is for a massive breakfast burrito in a hole in the wall local Mexican place. Thick ham and molten cheese with eggs and either potatoes or rice   But then afterwards I don't feel so well. Kind of like a food coma. But, at Good on Ya, I get the organic breakfast burrito in a spinach wrap with black beans, egg, avocado and Cotija cheese topped with salsa. So you get the big flavors but not as heavy on the metabolism   It's not cheap but it's legit organic and made with care.

data.title: Awesome vegan options
data.text: Came here a few times while visiting Encinitas.  The food is delicious and fresh.  I particularly like the avocado toast with tomatoes and feta cheese.  The multi grain bread is so good.  The only disappointment was that one weekend they were out of feta for a few days?  How hard is it to find feta in town?  lol  The matcha they serve is great and it tastes more traditional as opposed to other places.  Loved it.  Will always come back here when in Encinitas.

data.title: Great healthy, organic dining option
data.text: First, we loved the name.  Then we loved the brand.  But they won us over on the healthy, creative, organic food options.  Spot on.

data.title: Wish we went sooner!
data.text: Last place we ate before our flight home... I'm still dreaming of my California burrito! So yummy. Had a lovely Coconut oil coffee and bought a nice protein bar for the flight. Wish I had bought a glass straw while I was there too, glad they were promoting the use of them. Can't wait to eat there again :) YUM.

data.title: bulletproof coffee
data.text: Their menu calls Bullet Proof, brain coffee. But, it's the same creamy goodness of grass fed butter and coconut oil in your coffee then blended. Food all looked amazing but we had already had lunch. Just wanted an afternoon caffeine lift.

data.title: Acai Smoothie!
data.text: Popped in for a late afternoon thirst feed and was fully satisfied with the Acai Smoothie.  The guy behind the counter proudly announced that he made a killer egg sandwich which I'll give a go next visit.  Clean, fresh, really good!

data.title: Great healthy food
data.text: Love their breakfast. Waffles and eggs and breakfast burrito.  Great coffee choices. Everything organic and best of all from local vendors. Yeah for the little guy.

data.title: Cute organic cafe
data.text: Ate here twice during a weekend getaway to SoCal. Simple menu but everything was fresh and delicious if not exactly unique. Tons of vegetarian and vegan options. Waffles were particularly good, but were sold out when we went back on Sunday afternoon. The kombucha on tap was excellent and loved the two patio options for eating outside.

data.title: The best
data.text:
The food here is just the best. It's Organic, healthy and it taste great. The employees are so helpful and have great suggestions. We will be back again. 
Love their Hydrate drink also.

data.title: Healthy. Fresh. Good. Simple food, but quality food
data.text: We like their salads, their wraps, their smoothies and specialty beverages. The staff is very nice and accommodating.

data.title: Best Coffee!
data.text: By far the best coffee and interesting selection of food I have tried in Encinitas. Fantastic friendly staff and healthy options.

data.title: Breakfast date
data.text: Amazing coffee!!! And the benefits of butter in your coffee are superb! Love love their Open Face Egg Sandwich and the vegan zucchini muffins are to die for! The service is outstanding and they don't mind if we come visit everyday. :-).  Always clean inside and dog friendly outside. One of my favorite eating spots.

data.title: Good ingredients. IMHO, average in tastiness for this guy.
data.text: We decided to give GoodOnYa a try today for lunch. It was a hot sunny day and we enjoyed the open atmosphere indoors, although we ended up sitting outside. We ordered a veggie scramble, and a chicken salad. The ingredients tasted fresh and healthy, but IMHO, the food was "medium" in the taste category. We'd probably go back, but wouldn't make it a regular stop.

data.title: Healthy, organic goodness!
data.text: Finally, there's a healthy option for lunch in Encinitas with delicious, fresh organic food! The Goodon Ya Deli is a super casual spot at the South end of town right on the 101. Big thanks to the owner, Kris Buchanan, for her dedication in bringing tasty nutritious food to a community over run with greasy Mexican and ubiquitous Italian eateries. Everything we tried from the mint ice tea to the veggie wrap with a light yummy coconut tortilla to the crunchy kale salad was fantastic.

data.title: Healthy, tasty, fresh!
data.text: We  just had lunch at the new GoodOnYa location in Encinitas. We ordered Veggie Sandwich #1 on Artisan  whole grain bread and a Veggie Wrap on a Spinach wrap. Both were delicious! The service was great. The owner, Kris, took our order and made us feel truly appreciated for coming by. What a great addition for Encinitas!
